data.title: Blues announce jersey schedule for 2023-24 season
data.meta_description: Sweater rotation includes home blue, away white, Heritage blue and '90s Vintage
data.text:
The St. Louis Blues will wear four different sweaters during the 2023-24 season, four styles that have iconized the team in recent years.

Returning for all Saturday night home games is the lighter-blue Heritage jersey, and the '90s Vintage sweater makes its lone appearance when the Blues host the Los Angels Kings on March 13.

Here is the full jersey schedule for the 2023-24 season:

The old-school, colorful '90s Vintage jersey, seen once last season, will be worn for another game this year as the Blues take on the Kings in a nationally-televised matchup.

When to see it:

March 13 vs. Los Angeles Kings

After its return to the sweater rotation for the 2017 Winter Classic, the light blue Heritage jersey has become a staple of Saturday games at Enterprise Center. The classic design will continue in this tradition, appearing 11 times in total this season.

When to see it:

Oct. 14 vs. Seattle Kraken

Oct. 21 vs. Pittsburgh Penguins

Nov. 4 vs. Montreal Canadiens

Dec. 16 vs. Dallas Stars

Dec. 23 vs. Chicago Blackhawks

Jan. 13 vs. Boston Bruins

Jan. 20 vs. Washington Capitals

Feb. 17 vs. Nashville Predators

March 2 vs. Minnesota Wild

March 16 vs. Minnesota Wild

March 30 vs. San Jose Sharks

The Blues continue to wear their Home blue sweater in front of the fans at Enterprise Center - 29 games in total this season.

When to see it:
